channel.title: New way to gamble?
channel.description:
Well since everyone on mscp almost trust each other. Why don't we all place like 100k bets(Like 3-5 people) then guess a number 1-5 or whatever then use random.org, Person who gets it dead on wins o.o?
[hr] 100k: tinyscape: 5 100k: Krackkid: 2 100k: imsuperman05: 3 100k: drubrkletern: 1 100k: baddy: 4

item.title: New way to gamble?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

News: I have my laptop hooked up to my 32inch tv and repairing system files now. I will be able to host a games until further notice. Each game that I host will be at 10pm central time. It is 8:05pm at time of this post.

IGN: Malta Caves

How I will do things:
Betters will determine how much they will bet with eachother. I am in no discretion but to set the cap at around 600k. I would go higher but I don’t want people to loose more than I can make in f2p a day.

Each round will be 5-10 players. I will write a java program with the hardcoded list of players names. It will pick 3 randomly from this list, then pick 1 from those. I will ofc release the source. I will not deal with guessing numbers as a random number generator has a low chance of dealing a 1 or 5 when it is generating a number between those.

EDIT: Looks like my computer fixed just minutes after posting this.

Read full topic

item.title: New way to gamble?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:70, topic:422448”][quote author=baddy351 link=topic=525115.msg3823821#msg3823821 date=1322003188]
in what programming language? I would assume c++…
[/quote]
Java, this is why it is painfully slow. After last night I am bringing production for that to a hault and will start learning C++ and better methods for compression, maybe even optimize it for multi-core processors. As of right now, it takes around 30 minutes to compress a 500mb file. Will probably scrap this project if I cannot get that down to at least 10 minutes in a week.[/quote]

Java isn’t that slow. Presuming you designed the system modularly, each component method should be called enough times to be compiled to native code. If you want to be really sure it’s Java, just force the VM to compile every method invocation to native code, then run the algorithm through a few times with small files to make sure all of the methods are compiled. Then run it through with a big file and document it. Compare results to previous documentations.

What kind of compression ratios have you achieved? What exactly is your approach to compression?

Read full topic

I’m available if anybody wanted to set up another game. Sorry about last night, got in the middle of editing my compression code for better speed.

Anyways, the I have a new idea for this. Instead of only 100k bets, let the betters decide how much to bet. Krack, get on MSN, we could setup some kind of PHP pages etc to assist on this.

EDIT: Apparently I am still a member lol. Havent logged in 125 days. Logged in, and got the popup “thank you for being a continued member”. Last time I checked this was no longer comming off my card.
[/quote]

You are architecting a compression algorithm?[/quote]
It is far from anything worth showing off. It is very slow, and my format is very sloppy.
